name: copilot-atlassian-tools
description: This extension delivers possibilites to connect to the atlassian api and enhance copilot usage with additional context from your project.

copilot-atlassian-tools.atlassianSuiteUr.description: URL to your Atlassian suite (e.g., https://your-domain.atlassian.net)

copilot-atlassian-tools.atlassianEmail.description: Your Atlassian account email address (e.g., yourname@domain.com)

copilot-atlassian-tools.atlassianOAuthTo.description: OAuth token for Atlassian API access (See: https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens)

languageModelTools.name: copilot-atlassian-tools-confluence-search
languageModelTools.userDescription: Searches your Confluence instance for content matching the provided query.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Searches your Confluence instance for content matching the provided query. The result will be a list of pages that match the search criteria. It gives additional content to users questions based on their confluence documentation and can so help understanding the users request.

keywords.description: The keywords to search for in Confluence. This should be an array of keywords that you want to search for in your Confluence instance.

languageModelTools.name: copilot-atlassian-tools-jira-search
languageModelTools.userDescription: Searches your Jira instance for content matching the provided query.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Searches your Jira instance for content matching the provided query. The result will be a list of issues that match the search criteria. It gives additional content to users questions based on their jira documentation and can so help understanding the users request.

keywords.description: The keywords to search for in Jira. This should be an array of keywords that you want to search for in your Jira instance.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
